The **42nd[Ryder Cup](/wiki/Ryder_Cup "Ryder Cup") Matches** will be held in
[France](/wiki/France "France") from 28–30 September 2018 on the Albatros
Course of [Le Golf National](/wiki/Le_Golf_National "Le Golf National") in
[Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines](/wiki/Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines "Saint-Quentin-en-
Yvelines"), a suburb southwest of [Paris](/wiki/Paris "Paris"). It will be the
second Ryder Cup to be held in [Continental Europe](/wiki/Continental_Europe
"Continental Europe"), after the [1997 contest](/wiki/1997_Ryder_Cup "1997
Ryder Cup"), which was held in [Spain](/wiki/Valderrama_Golf_Club "Valderrama
Golf Club"). The United States is the [defending
champion](/wiki/2016_Ryder_Cup "2016 Ryder Cup"), but has lost the last five
matches in [Europe](/wiki/Europe "Europe"), having last won there in
[1993](/wiki/1993_Ryder_Cup "1993 Ryder Cup").

## Format[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_Ryder_Cup&action=edit&section=1 "Edit
section: Format")]

The [Ryder Cup](/wiki/Ryder_Cup "Ryder Cup") is a [match
play](/wiki/Match_play "Match play") event, with each match worth one point.
The competition format will be as follows:

  * **Day 1** (Friday) – 4 [foursome](/wiki/Foursome_\(golf\) "Foursome \(golf\)") (alternate shot) matches and 4 [fourball](/wiki/Four-ball_golf "Four-ball golf") (better ball) matches
  * **Day 2** (Saturday) – 4 foursome matches and 4 fourball matches
  * **Day 3** (Sunday) – 12 singles matches

On the first two days there will be 4 fourball matches in the morning and 4
foursome matches in the afternoon.

With a total of 28 points available, 14½ points are required to win the Cup,
and 14 points are required for the defending champion, the United States, to
retain the Cup. All matches are played to a maximum of 18 holes.

## Bidding for the 2018 Ryder
Cup[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_Ryder_Cup&action=edit&section=2 "Edit
section: Bidding for the 2018 Ryder Cup")]

Ryder Cup Europe confirmed originally six countries – France, Germany, the
Netherlands, Portugal, Spain and Sweden – to be interested in bidding for the
2018 Ryder Cup.[1] The deadline for the submission of bids was set for 30
April 2010; Sweden withdrew from the bidding early that month,[2] while the
Spanish bidding host city of [Tres Cantos](/wiki/Tres_Cantos "Tres Cantos")
showed poor popular support.[3][4]

There were five bids to host the event:

  * **France** : Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines[5][6]
  * **Germany** : Neuburg/Rohrenfeld
  * **Portugal** : Lisbon/Comporta, Alentejo Coast
  * **Spain** : Madrid/Guadarrama
  * **Netherlands** : Rotterdam/Lingewaal

France was announced as host on 17 May 2011, despite calls for the Cup to be
held in Spain, as a tribute to the late [Seve
Ballesteros](/wiki/Seve_Ballesteros "Seve Ballesteros").[7]

## Team qualification and
selection[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_Ryder_Cup&action=edit&section=4 "Edit
section: Team qualification and selection")]

###
[![Europe](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b7/Flag_of_Europe.svg/23px-
Flag_of_Europe.svg.png)](/wiki/Europe "Europe")
Europe[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_Ryder_Cup&action=edit&section=5 "Edit
section: Europe")]

The European team qualification rules were announced on 18 January 2017. There
were a number of changes compared to 2016 with an increase in the number of
captain's picks from three to four. The team will consist of:[8][9]

  * **The leading four players on the Race to Dubai Points List**
    * Points earned in all [Race to Dubai](/wiki/Race_to_Dubai "Race to Dubai") tournaments starting with the 2017 [D+D Real Czech Masters](/wiki/D%2BD_Real_Czech_Masters "D+D Real Czech Masters") and ending with the 2018 [Made in Denmark](/wiki/Made_in_Denmark "Made in Denmark") that finishes on 2 September 2018. Points earned from the 2018 [BMW PGA Championship](/wiki/BMW_PGA_Championship "BMW PGA Championship") onwards, will be multiplied by 1.5.
  * **The leading four players, not qualified above, on the World Points List**
    * Total World Points earned in [Official World Golf Ranking](/wiki/Official_World_Golf_Ranking "Official World Golf Ranking") events starting on 31 August 2017 (the start date of the D+D Real Czech Masters) and ending on 26 August 2018 and thereafter only at the [Made in Denmark](/wiki/Made_in_Denmark "Made in Denmark") tournament. Points earned from the date of the 2018 [BMW PGA Championship](/wiki/BMW_PGA_Championship "BMW PGA Championship") onwards, will be multiplied by 1.5. No World points will be earned from tournaments staged opposite Rolex Series tournaments in both [2017](/wiki/2017_European_Tour "2017 European Tour") and 2018.
  * **Four captain 's picks**

Membership criteria for the [European Tour](/wiki/European_Tour "European
Tour") have been reduced from five tournaments to four (outside the majors and
WGCs) for the 2018 season. As in previous Ryder Cups, all players must be
members of the European Tour to be eligible to play for Europe. Changes were
also made to the eligibility of future captains and vice-captains.

Current points lists: <http://www.rydercup.com/rankings>

[Paul Casey](/wiki/Paul_Casey "Paul Casey") became a member of the European
Tour at the start of 2018. Since he was not a member during 2017 he did not
earn points until the start of 2018.[10]

### [![United
States](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/23px-
Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png)](/wiki/United_States "United States")
United States[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_Ryder_Cup&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: United States")]

The United States qualification rules were announced on 8 February 2017.[11]
The majority of the team will be selected from the Ryder Cup points list which
is based on prize money won in important tournaments. Generally one point is
awarded for every $1,000 earned. The team will consist of:

  * **The leading eight players on the Ryder Cup points list, gained in the following events**
    * 2017 [major championships](/wiki/Men%27s_major_golf_championships "Men's major golf championships")
    * 2017 [World Golf Championship](/wiki/World_Golf_Championship "World Golf Championship") events and [The Players Championship](/wiki/The_Players_Championship "The Players Championship") (half points)
    * 2018 [major championships](/wiki/Men%27s_major_golf_championships "Men's major golf championships") (double points for the winner, 50% extra for those who make the cut)
    * 2018 [PGA Tour](/wiki/PGA_Tour "PGA Tour") events. Qualifying events in this category are those played between 1 January and 12 August 2018, the date of the [PGA Championship](/wiki/PGA_Championship "PGA Championship"), and including the Zurich Classic of New Orleans team event. "Alternate" events (those played opposite a major or WGC event) did not earn points
  * **Four captain 's picks**
    * Three announced after the 2018 [Dell Technologies Championship](/wiki/Dell_Technologies_Championship "Dell Technologies Championship"), which concludes on 3 September.
    * One announced after the 2018 [BMW Championship](/wiki/BMW_Championship_\(PGA_Tour\) "BMW Championship \(PGA Tour\)"), which concludes on 9 September.

The qualification rules were similar to those used for the 2016 Ryder Cup. The
points given for the current season [major
championships](/wiki/Men%27s_major_golf_championships "Men's major golf
championships") have been reduced from double to 50% extra (except for the
winner who still gets double points). The dates on which the captain's picks
are made has been brought forward by one or two weeks.

## Teams[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_Ryder_Cup&action=edit&section=7 "Edit
section: Teams")]

### Captains[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_Ryder_Cup&action=edit&section=8
"Edit section: Captains")]

[Thomas Bjørn](/wiki/Thomas_Bj%C3%B8rn "Thomas Bjørn") was named as the
European captain on 6 December 2016. He was chosen by a five-man panel made up
of the three most recent European Ryder Cup captains ([Darren
Clarke](/wiki/Darren_Clarke "Darren Clarke"), [Paul
McGinley](/wiki/Paul_McGinley "Paul McGinley") and [José María
Olazábal](/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Mar%C3%ADa_Olaz%C3%A1bal "José María Olazábal")),
the Chief Executive of the [European Tour](/wiki/European_Tour "European
Tour"), Keith Pelley and European Tour Tournament Committee member [Henrik
Stenson](/wiki/Henrik_Stenson "Henrik Stenson").[13]

[Jim Furyk](/wiki/Jim_Furyk "Jim Furyk") was named as the USA captain on 11
January 2017.[14]

### Vice-
captains[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_Ryder_Cup&action=edit&section=9 "Edit
section: Vice-captains")]

Each captain selects a number of vice-captains to assist him during the
tournament.

Bjørn selected [Robert Karlsson](/wiki/Robert_Karlsson "Robert Karlsson") as
his first vice-captain in May 2017.[15] In May 2018 he selected four more
vice-captains: [Luke Donald](/wiki/Luke_Donald "Luke Donald"), [Pádraig
Harrington](/wiki/P%C3%A1draig_Harrington "Pádraig Harrington"), [Graeme
McDowell](/wiki/Graeme_McDowell "Graeme McDowell") and [Lee
Westwood](/wiki/Lee_Westwood "Lee Westwood").

Furyk named [Davis Love III](/wiki/Davis_Love_III "Davis Love III") as a vice-
captain, soon after his appointment in January 2017. He later added [Steve
Stricker](/wiki/Steve_Stricker "Steve Stricker") and [Tiger
Woods](/wiki/Tiger_Woods "Tiger Woods") in February 2018.[16]
